title: Communicating Ocean Sciences to Informal Audiences
description: Simultaneous focus on developing a knowledge of ocean sciences and the advanced educational approaches for communicating that knowledge. Teaching skills developed through coursework, outreach events and design of collaborative projects at museums and aquariums. Primary objective is to learn how to present ocean-themed hands-on, inquiry-based science exhibits, in order to improve the scientific literacy of audiences of all ages. Mandatory field trips required. 1 lecture, 2 activities.
prerequisites: BIO 328, ZOO 322, ZOO 336 or PSC 201; completion of GE A; and GE Area B2 or BIO 211; Junior standing
